title: ValueError: could not convert string to int
body_html:
I am trying to resize this image and here's my code. But while running it shows an error ValueError: could not convert string to int. Can someone tell me where I am going wrong?

import` torch
model = torch.load('/home/smitha/ccpem_project/MRC2tif_2/Falcon_2015_05_14-20_42_18.tif')

normalize = transforms.Normalize(
    mean=[0.485, 0.456, 0.406],
    std=[0.229, 0.224, 0.225]
)
preprocess = transforms.Compose([
    transforms.Scale(256),
    transforms.CenterCrop(224),
    transforms.ToTensor(),
    normalize
])

img = Image.open(IMG_URL)
img_tensor = preprocess(img)
img_tensor.unsqueeze_(0)
output = `model(Variable(img_tensor))`
```

Error:
```
ValueError                                Traceback (most recent call last)
<ipython-input-1-a38b3d8d2ca4> in <module>()
      1 import torch
----> 2 model = torch.load('/home/smitha/ccpem_project/MRC2tif_2/Falcon_2015_05_14-20_42_18.tif')
      3 
      4 normalize = transforms.Normalize(
      5     mean=[0.485, 0.456, 0.406],

~/anaconda3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/torch/serialization.py in load(f, map_location, pickle_module)
    356         f = open(f, 'rb')
    357     try:
--> 358         return _load(f, map_location, pickle_module)
    359     finally:
    360         if new_fd:

~/anaconda3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/torch/serialization.py in _load(f, map_location, pickle_module)
    530             f.seek(0)
    531 
--> 532     magic_number = pickle_module.load(f)
    533     if magic_number != MAGIC_NUMBER:
    534         raise RuntimeError("Invalid magic number; corrupt file?")

ValueError: could not convert string to int
```

body:
I am trying to resize this image and here's my code. But while running it shows an error ValueError: could not convert string to int. Can someone tell me where I am going wrong?

````
import` torch
model = torch.load('/home/smitha/ccpem_project/MRC2tif_2/Falcon_2015_05_14-20_42_18.tif')

normalize = transforms.Normalize(
    mean=[0.485, 0.456, 0.406],
    std=[0.229, 0.224, 0.225]
)
preprocess = transforms.Compose([
    transforms.Scale(256),
    transforms.CenterCrop(224),
    transforms.ToTensor(),
    normalize
])

img = Image.open(IMG_URL)
img_tensor = preprocess(img)
img_tensor.unsqueeze_(0)
output = `model(Variable(img_tensor))`
```

Error:
```
ValueError                                Traceback (most recent call last)
<ipython-input-1-a38b3d8d2ca4> in <module>()
      1 import torch
----> 2 model = torch.load('/home/smitha/ccpem_project/MRC2tif_2/Falcon_2015_05_14-20_42_18.tif')
      3 
      4 normalize = transforms.Normalize(
      5     mean=[0.485, 0.456, 0.406],

~/anaconda3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/torch/serialization.py in load(f, map_location, pickle_module)
    356         f = open(f, 'rb')
    357     try:
--> 358         return _load(f, map_location, pickle_module)
    359     finally:
    360         if new_fd:

~/anaconda3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/torch/serialization.py in _load(f, map_location, pickle_module)
    530             f.seek(0)
    531 
--> 532     magic_number = pickle_module.load(f)
    533     if magic_number != MAGIC_NUMBER:
    534         raise RuntimeError("Invalid magic number; corrupt file?")

ValueError: could not convert string to int
```
